1.title: Protect Yourself
1.plot: Host Jack Rico shows you how to choose the right bike helmet, how to protect your wireless router from hackers, and a teen driver gets a lesson from a top expert.

2.title: Fully Loaded
2.plot: Host Jack Rico dives into the fascinating technology behind the cars of the future, participates in an unusual challenge involving a kitchen appliance, and we go shopping with the help of a top scientist.

3.title: On Air
3.plot: Host Jack Rico is on a mission to rid microscopic pollutants from the air in your home. He helps out in a laboratory that tests vacuum cleaners, and finds out whether it's worth trying to repair your smartphone screen yourself.

4.title: Buckle Up
4.plot: Host Jack Wico shows you how to keep your cool when hydroplaning, how to organize your fridge to save money and waste less food, and how to stay safe using peer-to-peer payment apps.

5.title: First Class
5.plot: Host Jack Rico heads to the Consumer Reports auto test track to get behind the wheel with a top car tester at his side to learn how to drive like a pro. The he meets the test teams who subject door locks to all sorts of abuse to see how strong they are and whether they truly protect your home from would-be burglars. And if traveling coach leaves you feeling sore, sleepless and frustrated, don't miss these tips to transform your economy experience into a journey fit for royalty.

6.title: High Noon
6.plot: It's high noon in the test lab as host Jack Rico faces off with a Consumer Reports expert in a power drill challenge. And, many people love to grill but cleaning it afterwards can be a chore so Jack brushes up on his grill cleaning techniques. Then, 4K, HDR, LED: modern TVs seem to have a language all of their own so we set out to decode television terminology.

7.title: Tread Carefully
7.plot: It's a work out like no other as host Jack Rico struggles to keep up with "Johnnie," an automated device used to test treadmills. Then, we get a fascinating look inside the mind of a top scientist by asking him to perform a simple task: clean a kitchen. And, to buy or to lease? We have some useful tips to help you arrive at the right decision when buying a car.

8.title: Right Fit
8.plot: Host Jack Rico helps Consumer Reports technicians turn up the heat on barbecues in the test lab to see how well they cook and how strong they are. Then, credit card ownership can be full of pitfalls so Jack learns some money saving strategies from an expert. And, they may fit your bed but how do you fit them into your linen closet? Consumer 101 has the 411 on folding a fitted sheet.

9.title: Power Up
9.plot: Host Jack Rico learns how to drive off road with the help of a top Consumer Reports expert. Then we have some useful tips to keep your phone charged up while on the go. And we learn the best way to organize a yard sale.

10.title: Leading the March
10.plot: With the help of a high school marching band we get a fascinating a look at what happens to sound in an "anechoic chamber," a room with no echo. Then, host Jack Rico learns all about modern car safety features with the help of Consumer Reports experts. And Jack finds out the dos and don'ts of preparing a meal safely.

12.title: Be Smart
12.plot: Many consumers love their smart TVs but how much information does it gather from you? We meet the teams that evaluate sunscreen to keep consumers safe from the harmful effects of the sun. And a Consumer Reports expert shows host Jack Rico the safest and most effective way to pack up your car for a trip.

13.title: Rico & Rico
13.plot: Host Jack Rico learns the correct way to paint a wall from a Consumer Reports expert with a similar name. Then we take to the skies as Jack learns all about drones. And we look at the science behind fuel economy testing.

14.title: Rest Assured
14.plot: Host Jack Rico digs deep into how to find the right snowblower to clear a driveway. Then, is there a safe way to use a cell phone while driving? And with the help of a Consumer Reports expert, Jack learns all about choosing the right mattress to help get a good night's sleep.

15.title: Way Ahead
15.plot: Host Jack Rico heads to the Consumer Reports auto test track to learn from a top car tester how to drive like a pro. Then we have some top tips on how to stay safe when using a peer to peer payment app. And we get a fascinating look inside the mind of a top scientist by asking him to perform a simple task: clean a kitchen.

11.title: Sensing Danger
11.plot: Host Jack Rico learns what to do if you start hydroplaning on a wet road. Then he gets advice from a top Consumer Reports expert on how to protect your Wi-Fi router from hackers. And a fascinating look inside the mind of a top scientist as he performs a simple task: going shopping.
